EffectManager Class Reference

#include <EffectManager.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

EffectManager is the class that handles effects and effect categories.

It maintains a graph of effect categories and subcategories, registers and unregisters effects and can return filtered lists of effects.

Member Function Documentation

EffectManager & EffectManager::Get (  )  [static]

Get the singleton instance of the EffectManager. Probably not safe for multi-thread use.

int  AdditionalFlags = 0

Register an effect so it will appear in the menu.

void EffectManager::UnregisterEffects (  ) 

Unregister all effects.

Effect * EffectManager::GetEffect ( int  ID  ) 

Return an effect by its numerical ID.

int EffectManager::GetNumEffects (  ) 

Return the number of registered effects.

EffectArray * EffectManager::GetEffects ( int  flags = ALL_EFFECTS  ) 

Returns a sorted array of effects, which may be filtered using the flags parameter. The caller should dispose of the array when done.

EffectCategory * EffectManager::AddCategory ( const wxString &  URI,
const wxString &  name 
)

Add a new effect category with the given URI and name and return a pointer to it. If a category with this URI already exists, return that instead.

EffectCategory * EffectManager::LookupCategory ( const wxString &  URI  ) 

Return a pointer to the effect category with the given URI or 0 if no such category has been added.

bool EffectManager::AddCategoryParent ( EffectCategory *  child,
EffectCategory *  parent 
)

Make one category the parent of another category. Both categories must have been returned from AddCategory() or LookupCategory(). If the new parent-child relationship would create any loops in the graph of categories false will be returned and the graph will not be modified, otherwise the function will return true.

void EffectManager::FreezeCategories (  ) 

Freeze the subcategory relations between all categories added so far.

const CategorySet & EffectManager::GetRootCategories (  )  const

Return the set of all root categories, i.e. the ones without parents.

EffectSet EffectManager::GetUnsortedEffects ( int  flags = ALL_EFFECTS  )  const

Return the set of all uncategorised effects.
